summary: This bill, the Haiti Economic Lift Program Extension Act of 2025, aims to extend duty-free treatment for imports from Haiti under the Caribbean Basin Economic Recovery Act. It modifies existing provisions related to the percentage of apparel imports eligible for preferential treatment and adjusts the termination date to September 30, 2035. The bill also directs the President to restore eligibility for certain articles that previously qualified for preferential treatment, contingent on a report to congressional committees.
